definition: (fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
order/sequence/preface
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
old variant of 幕[mu4]/curtain/screen

sentences.english: The talent show in the evening drew the curtain with guitar playing.
sentences.chinese: 晚间的才艺表演在吉它的弹唱中拉开序幕。

sentences.english: The concert in the solemn GuoGeSheng in between the two countries.
sentences.chinese: 音乐会在庄严的中俄两国国歌声中拉开序幕。

sentences.english: Party in a cheerful sound of gongs and drums kicked off.
sentences.chinese: 联欢会在一片欢快的锣鼓声中拉开序幕。

sentences.english: The good news for foreign companies is that the game is still early.
sentences.chinese: 对外国公司来说，好消息是这出戏才刚刚拉开序幕。

sentences.english: The all-Russia annual carving contest takes place in Moscow.
sentences.chinese: 一年一度的俄罗斯雕刻大赛在莫斯科拉开序幕。

definition: prologue
heavy curtain
to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
to beat the gong to open a performance
the curtain drops/the end of the show
to hold (a meeting, ceremony etc)
to arrive as planned/right on schedule
to open (a conference)/to inaugurate
imminent
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
overture
formal/official
coda/epilogue/end
to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
opera (or role) involving much singing and action/(fig.) highlight/main feature/major activity
